general.about:
Leads knowledge and data products at Arghyam and India Water Portal.

Building for the next billion. Interested in climate action, accesibility, learning and inclusion.

projects.heading: Scaling Community Engagement at Foundation for Ecological Society
projects.title: Scaling Community Engagement

projects.heading: Learning Platforms at Sunbird
projects.description:
Helped pivot Arghyam from a traditional philanthropy to an ecosystem enabler. Inspired by the Digital Public Goods Alliance. 

I led a multi stakeholder team in developing and deploying a learning management system with a focus on openness and sharing. 

Trainers were able to create modules easily, translate modules easily and partners were able to build courses from all available content, not just their own. 

Codebase of new modules created were contributed to the ecosystem. All content created on the platform was Creative Commons (CC BY 4.0)
projects.title: Learning Platforms

projects.heading: Open Water Data at DataMeet & Center for Internet and Society
projects.description:
As I started managing India Water Portal, I realized that most nonprofits who are poised to use GIS tools do not have an understanding on availability of datasets on groundwater and related resources(Land Use/Land Cover, Precipitation).

Commissioned this grant to analyze available datasets and to build a prototype that can overlay selected datasets.
projects.title: Open Water Data
projects.company: DataMeet & Center for Internet and Society

projects.heading: Kobo for Water at Multiple Indian Nonprofits
projects.description:
Built workflows to collect data for groundwater monitoring, trained NGOs across India

Having used ODK in the previous projects and understanding its limitations (lack of case management, ease of use, and update lags) I evaluated other open and SaaS data collection platforms

I rolled out KoboCollect with templates for groundwater data that nonprofit partners can quickly duplicate and collect data about their groundwater resources.

Trained NGOs in Meghalaya, Mizoram and Tripura on how to collect data, data standards and interpreting collected data.

These rollouts led to National Mission on Himalayan Studies
(NMHS) implementing tools and standards in Uttarakhand, Nagaland and Arunachal Pradesh
projects.title: Kobo for Water

projects.heading: Odisha Springs at UNDP
projects.description:
Customized ODK to build an inventory of springs in 3 districts of Odisha.

Consulted water experts and local data collecting volunteers to create standards

Trained 50 people over 2 days to collect data of 300 springs in 2 months.

Collated and visualized this data that led to the creation of the 1000 Springs Initiative by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs
projects.title: Odisha Springs

sideProjects.heading: Boardgame community at ReRoll
sideProjects.description: ReRoll is a community-focused board games collective in Bangalore. What started as a way for a few friends to share our joy of boardgaming grew to become the largest board game group in India.
sideProjects.title: Boardgame community

sideProjects.heading: Coping with COVID at Pause to Begin
sideProjects.description: Collaborated with therapists to set up pro-bono therapy sessions during 1st and 2nd waves of COVID. I onboarded therapists onto a scheduling platform, trained them on how to use and customize their slots based on their availability.
sideProjects.title: Coping with COVID

workExperience.heading: Product Manager at Arghyam
workExperience.description:
Conceived, designed, and led end-to-end development of Jal Sarathi and Jal Soochak, Arghyam's flagship digital solutions for improving reliability, transparency, and accountability in rural drinking water supply systems under the Jal Jeevan Mission.

Designed and executed Jal Sarathi Phase 1 pilot across three districts, onboarding and training 136+ field workers (Jal Mitras) on a WhatsApp-based chatbot integrated with GPT Vision AI for automated bulk flow meter reading extraction.

Achieved 82% user satisfaction and 86% feature adoption for daily reminders; captured key learnings on AI accuracy, user engagement, and operational challenges to inform Phase 2 rollout.

Developed Jal Soochak as an open-source state-ready product, building capture, AI extraction, and engagement layers, with analytics and dashboard modules for multiple user roles (field workers, sectional officers, mission directors).

Drove integration with JJM Brain and state systems, established monitoring dashboards, and designed nudge strategies to improve BFM reading frequency and data quality.

Led cross-functional collaboration with government departments, NGOs, and technology vendors to take both products from concept to scalable deployment.
workExperience.title: Manager, Technology Products

workExperience.heading: Technology Manager at India Water Portal
workExperience.description:
Led development and editorial teams to maintain multiple media sites and knowledge platforms for India Water Portal, a dedicated knowledge portal on water.

Led editorial and content strategy, created the most listened podcast on water in India - [Voices for Water](https://www.youtube.com/@voicesforwater8481).

Scaled site architecture to support audience growth from 200k to 1.6 million per month.

Reduced AWS server expenses by consolidating services, optimizing servers, it led to annual savings of 40%.

Adopted Agile by working with multiple teams to bring predictability to feature releases.
workExperience.title: Technology Manager

workExperience.heading: Technology and Development Officer at Arghyam
workExperience.description:
Managed a SaaS based learning management system with 20k+ community users.

Managed tech-support team that deployed and handled L1 and L2 support across 9+ Indian states.

Enabled 1500+ trainers to adopt to our platform by creating and sharing best practices.

Reduced onboarding time from 10 to 2 days by templating process for new partners.

Managed multiple data and technology products

Spearheaded implementation of Open-source Learning Management System.

Mentored water experts to recreate courses from slides to reusable learning modules.

Established field data collection tools for community workers to monitor groundwater levels.
workExperience.title: Technology and Development Officer

workExperience.heading: Product Associate at Essmart Global
workExperience.description:
Researched pricing feasibility and market feasibility for new services and products.

Trained rural field agents to conduct product demos and installations of new products.
workExperience.title: Product Associate

workExperience.heading: Evangelist at Artoo
workExperience.description:
Developed client acquisition and developer engagement pipelines.

On-field product research and demo of software to prospective clients. 

Created developer community events and outreach practices that improved hiring
workExperience.title: Evangelist

workExperience.heading: Engineer at Artoo
workExperience.description:
Created web modules for microfinance workflows between field agents and loan officers. 

Built a custom module for content providers to develop and deploy learning content.

Designed interfaces for first-time technology users with low-end smartphones.

Reduced survey duration from 4 hours to 45 minutes with form automations.

Optimized monitoring and validation of field data for loan officers.
workExperience.title: Engineer

volunteering.heading: Frontiers and Frames for a new Digitality at IT for Change
volunteering.description: Was part of a 5-day institute by IT for Change to capacitate civil society actors with the necessary vocabulary and tools to appropriately frame and approach emerging digital intersections with their work, as well as develop strategies for effective political organization.
volunteering.title: Frontiers and Frames for a new Digitality

volunteering.heading: Working Group Member at MySociety
volunteering.description: As part of the TICTeC Labs programme, mySociety convened TICTeC Action Lab (aka working group) to discuss common challenges in using civic tech to encourage people to change and coordinate their behaviour in ways that can cause significant changes in society, specifically through the lens of climate action.
volunteering.title: Working Group Member

volunteering.heading: Contributor at National Data Platform
volunteering.description: As part of the consultations for upcoming National Data Platform, I gave inputs on the proposed technical architecture. I shared nonprofits challenges in contributing and accessing open data.
volunteering.title: Contributor

volunteering.heading: Member at Karnataka Jnana Aayoga (Karnataka Knowledge Commision)
volunteering.description: Advised Data Management Sub Group for Karnataka State Water Policy on data gaps in public data, need for community owned data governance and management.
volunteering.title: Member

volunteering.heading: Mentor at NCore Hackathon
volunteering.description: Mentored teams working on solutions for water security, by sharing data, limitations of current alternatives.
volunteering.title: Mentor

volunteering.heading: Volunteer at DataMeet
volunteering.description:
Hosted the first Bangalore Open Data Camp, an unconference with participation from NGOs, data scientists, technology firms and social impact business.

Also ran workshops to liberate data, and manage the community.
volunteering.title: Volunteer

volunteering.heading: Volunteer at HasGeek
volunteering.description:
Love the community, volunteered in different roles over the years - logistics, video streaming, network setup, speaker support and the likes.

Learnt from talks, interacted with experts, was an overall ball to be a part of.
volunteering.title: Volunteer
